name: Modules.Geofence
summary: Provides a battery-efficient way to monitor a device's movement into or out of a geographic region.

events.name: error
events.summary: Fired when there is an error, or monitoring failed for a region.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: A string that describes the error.

properties.name: errorcode
properties.summary: A number that describes the error (Android, only). Can be one of the following: LOCATION_STATUS_ERROR, LOCATION_STATUS_GEOFENCE_NOT_AVAILABLE, LOCATION_STATUS_GEOFENCE_TOO_MANY_GEOFENCES, LOCATION_STATUS_GEOFENCE_TOO_MANY_PENDING_INTENTS

properties.name: regions
properties.summary: The regions for which monitoring failed. On iOS, this property contains an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects representing the regions for which monitoring failed. On Android, this property contains an array of generic objects, each of which has an identifier property that corresponds to the region(s) that were entered.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: enterregions
events.summary: Fired when the device enters a monitored region.

properties.name: regions
properties.summary: The region(s) that were entered. On iOS, this property contains an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects representing the regions that were entered. On Android, this property contains an array of generic objects, each of which has an identifier property that corresponds to the region(s) that were entered.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: exitregions
events.summary: Fired when the device exits a monitored region.

properties.name: regions
properties.summary: The region(s) that were exited. On iOS, this property contains an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects representing the regions that were exited. On Android, this property contains an array of generic objects, each of which has an identifier property that corresponds to the region(s) that were exited.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: monitorregions
events.summary: Fired when startMonitoringForRegions and monitoring has successfully started for those regions.

properties.name: regions
properties.summary: The region(s) for which monitoring has started. On iOS, this property contains an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects representing the regions for which monitoring has started. On Android, there is no property for you to check.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: regionstate
events.summary: Fired when requestStateForRegion requested a state or there is a state transition for a monitored region.

properties.name: region
properties.summary: The region that triggered the state change.

properties.name: state
properties.summary: The updated region state. One of REGION_STATE_*.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: removeregions
events.summary: Fired on Android when regions are removed using stopMonitoringForRegions or stopMonitoringAllRegions and monitoring has successfully stopped for those regions.

properties.name: regions
properties.summary: The region(s) for which monitoring has stopped. On iOS, this property contains an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects representing the regions for which monitoring has stopped. On Android, this property contains an array of generic objects, each of which has an identifier property that corresponds to the region(s) for which monitoring has stopped.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: createRegion
methods.description:
Example:

var region = Geofence.createRegion({
    center: {
        latitude: 37.38960100,
        longitude: -122.05016900
    },
    radius: 30,
    identifier: 'Appcelerator'
});

methods.name: isGooglePlayServicesAvailable
methods.summary: Returns a number value indicating the availability of Google Play Services which are required to monitor regions.
methods.description:
Possible values include SUCCESS, SERVICE_MISSING, SERVICE_VERSION_UPDATE_REQUIRED, SERVICE_DISABLED, and SERVICE_INVALID. Example:

var Playservices = require('ti.playservices');
var hasGooglePlayServices = Playservices.isGooglePlayServicesAvailable();

methods.name: regionMonitoringAvailable
methods.summary: Returns a boolean that indicates if region monitoring is supported on the current device.
methods.description:
Example:

var canMonitor = Geofence.regionMonitoringAvailable();

methods.name: requestStateForRegion
methods.summary: Asynchronously retrieve the cached state of the specified region.
methods.description: The state is returned to the delegate via the regionstate event.

methods.name: startMonitoringForRegions
methods.summary: Starts monitoring the Modules.Geofence.Region passed as a parameter.
methods.description:
Takes either an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects or a single Modules.Geofence.Region object as an argument.

On Android, if the device is located in a Modules.Geofence.Region that has just started being monitored, an enterregions event is generated. On iOS, this scenario will not generate an enterregions event; instead, call the containsCoordinate method on the newly Region object to check if the device is located within it.

Each platform limits the number of regions that can be monitored at one time. On iOS this limit is 20 regions, and 100 regions on Android. The following example creates a new Region object and then starts monitoring it.

var region1 = Geofence.createRegion({
    center: {
        latitude: 37.389601,
        longitude: -122.050169
    },
    radius: 500,
    identifier: 'Appcelerator'
});
Geofence.startMonitoringForRegions(region1);

parameters.name: Region
parameters.summary: Either an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects or a single Modules.Geofence.Region object.

methods.name: stopMonitoringAllRegions
methods.summary: Stops monitoring all of the regions that are currently being monitored.
methods.description:
This method is asynchronous on Android. The removeregions event will fire on completion.

Example:

Geofence.stopMonitoringAllRegions();

methods.name: stopMonitoringForRegions
methods.summary: Stops monitoring the specified region or regions.
methods.description:
Takes either an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects or a single Modules.Geofence.Region object as an argument.

This method is asynchronous on Android. The removeregions event will fire on completion.

Geofence.stopMonitoringForRegions([region, region1]);

parameters.name: Region
parameters.summary: Either an array of Modules.Geofence.Region objects or a single Modules.Geofence.Region object.

properties.name: monitoredRegions
properties.summary: An array of the regions currently being monitored for the current application.
properties.description:
Example:

var regions = Geofence.monitoredRegions;

constants.name: LOCATION_STATUS_ERROR
constants.summary: Possible value of the errorcode property in the error event object indicating an unspecified error occurred.

constants.name: LOCATION_STATUS_GEOFENCE_NOT_AVAILABLE
constants.summary: Possible value of the errorcode property in the error event object indicating the geofence service is not available now.

constants.name: LOCATION_STATUS_GEOFENCE_TOO_MANY_GEOFENCES
constants.summary: Possible value of the errorcode property in the error event object indicating your application has registered more than 100 geofences.

constants.name: LOCATION_STATUS_GEOFENCE_TOO_MANY_PENDING_INTENTS
constants.summary: Possible value of the errorcode property in the error event object.

constants.name: REGION_STATE_INSIDE
constants.summary: Possible value of the state property in the regionstate event object.
constants.description: The location is inside the given region.

constants.name: REGION_STATE_OUTSIDE
constants.summary: Possible value of the state property in the regionstate event object.
constants.description: The location is outside of the given region.

constants.name: REGION_STATE_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: Possible value of the state property in the regionstate event object.
constants.description: It is unknown whether the location is inside or outside of the region.
